quest.name: The Knight and the Maiden Fair
journal: Sidurgu would entreat a fellow dark knight for aid.

On his deathbed, Sidurgu's master spoke of a “flame in the abyss,” a concept which Sidurgu and Fray did not understand. In following the creed of their predecessors, they hoped that the meaning would become clear to them in time. Alas, when they intervened to save the life of a young girl, they were marked for death by the order. Fray was captured and executed in a trial by combat, leaving Sidurgu to care for Rielle by himself. Fearing that he cannot handle the task alone, he implores you to join his cause, and you agree. Perhaps now would be a good time to get to know Rielle.

Though somewhat standoffish, Rielle responds to your inquiries as best she can. Satisfied that you have established a rudimentary rapport, Sidurgu interrupts with his latest plan. Since the Temple Knights appear to be convinced that Rielle is some sort of abomination, Sidurgu would first determine if there is anything unusual about her. To that end, he proposes that you seek out a Vanu healer in the Sea of Clouds, as some are said to possess the ability to see their patients' aether. Rendezvous with him in Camp Cloudtop.

For the most part, the Vanu Vanu are disinclined to parley with outsiders. However, they may be willing to grant your request in exchange for a suitable offering. Sidurgu asks that you seek out and slay gastornis for their feathers, as it is said the Vanu use them in their rituals.
You procure the feathers with little difficulty. Journey now into Vanu territory and pray that you can find a healer willing to hear you out.

Fortuitously, you encounter a Vanu healer willing to examine Rielle in exchange for your offering of feathers. Arms held high, she begins chanting, her voice rising in intensity, until she gasps in surprise. A great spirit dwells within her, the healer begins─but before she can finish, she senses others following in your wake and flees. Turning towards the road, Sidurgu readies his sword and bids you search for your pursuers while he guards Rielle.
You come upon Temple Knights, who mark you for a foe at once. The battle is joined and soon ended. Return to Sidurgu and let him know what you found.
With the Vanu healer long gone, there is no reason to remain in the Sea of Clouds. Return to the Forgotten Knight with Sidurgu and Rielle.

Cursing the Temple Knights for their savagery, Sidurgu nearly flies into a rage, until Rielle's sudden apology for being the cause of your distress saps the dark knight of his anger. Though the motives of the Temple Knights yet remain a mystery, it is clear now that there is something rather unusual about the young girl they so fervently pursue.

※The next dark knight quest will be available from Sidurgu upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Rendezvous with Sidurgu at Camp Cloudtop.
Slay gastornis and obtain their feathers.
Present the feathers to the Vanu Vanu healer.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I see you yet walk the path, Forename...and it is well that you do. This is a matter I can discuss only with another dark knight. Swear to me that you will speak of it to no one else.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Thank you. Then I shall begin at the beginning.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Our master, in his final moments, spoke to Fray and me in riddles...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: “A heart bleeds, a man weeps, a soul burns. Thence comes the darkness, to consume...”

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: “Yet even in the depths, the flame endures...”

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: “Submit to the flame and harness the abyss...”

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Fray and I did not understand his words. We hoped their meaning would become clear to us in the course of our duties as dark knights.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: And so we carried on, following the creed, until one day, we found her.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: <sigh> ...Go on, Rielle. SheHe can be trusted.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...All right.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Halone's blessings be upon you, misssir.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Right, then...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: She was fleeing from a unit of Temple Knights at the time, who were clearly intent on doing her harm. Needless to say, Fray and I took issue with that, and chose to intervene.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: We went to ground after that, but Fray was caught out in the streets while fetching supplies...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...I cannot protect her, Forename. Not from the Temple Knights. Not by myself. I'm not even sure why they seek her...only that should I fail, her life is forfeit.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Help me, Forename, and I shall share with you my arts. And when we have reached the limits of my knowledge, mayhap we can unravel the mystery of my master's final words together.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I can offer you naught else. What say you?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Then it is settled. We shall both serve as her guardians.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Don't you have something to say to Forename, Rielle?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Talk to her a little. Ask her about herself.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...Yes?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you ask?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Why did the Temple Knights want to hurt you?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Where are your parents?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What do you think of Sidurgu?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: They...they said I was an abomination. That I had to die to atone for my sins...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: He doesn't talk as much. Not since Fray left. Sometimes he hardly speaks a word. Other times... But I know he would never hurt me.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Excuse me...Forename, was it?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: You'll look after Sid too, won't you?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Thank you. That puts my mind at ease...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Right, that's enough of that. To more important matters...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Like I said before, I'm not quite sure why the Temple Knights are after Rielle.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: They seem to believe something is wrong with her, but for the life of me, I cannot imagine what it could be...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: However, there may be a way to find out. The other day, I overheard a curious tale from a House Haillenarte knight recently returned from Camp Cloudtop. He spoke of Vanu healers who could see their patients' aether. So skilled were these healers that they could diagnose ailments with a glance.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: It may be naught more than a fantastical tale told by a man in his cups, but even so, if there is a chance we could learn what─if aught─ails Rielle, I daresay we must take it. Let us go to Camp Cloudtop and begin our search for a healer there.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: For Rielle's sake, I say we see if there is any truth to this rumor...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Did you know Fray too? He was a good teacher...and a friend.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: How is it that they float like that? I've never seen anything quite like it...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Right, then.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: The Vanu Vanu are not wont to parley with outsiders under most circumstances. However, they may be willing to receive us if we come bearing a suitable offering.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I am told they use gastornis feathers in their rituals. Mayhap that would suffice...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Forename, I must ask that you prepare our offering while I look after Rielle. Once you have it, we can journey to Vundu Ok' Bendu together and entreat one of their healers to examine her.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I feel fine, really...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Please take care, Forename...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: The Temple Knights have eyes everywhere, Forename. I dare not leave her unattended.

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: What mistral gale blows netherlings this far!? Away with you, away!

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: Gastornis feathers? Hmmm... Netherling knows the ways of the Vundu well.

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: Let storm clouds give way to warm sunshine. Say your piece!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: She will do as we ask, Forename?

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: Bring forth the child, netherlings. Let me look upon her face and know her heart!

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: Soft rains to soothe your heart, little one. Do not be afraid.

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: Drink of the winds! Let thy soul take flight! Bathe in the mists and show me thy light!

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: Come, come, show me thy light...

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: What tempestuous winds rage beneath tranquil clouds!? What great spirit dwells within you!?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Speak plain, Vanu.

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: This is no child...this is... Ah!

dialogue.name: VANUVANU02060
dialogue.text: The tramontane follows you, netherlings. You cannot remain here! Begone from our lands!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Wait! I don't... Godsdammit.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Ready your blade, Forename. We've been followed.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Over there─someone's coming...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Climb the ridge and stand watch. I'm staying with Rielle.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: How did they find us!?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: So it really was them...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: That should be the last of them.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Hm. I've seen these ones about before. They don't answer to the lord commander─or so I hear.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Bastards thought to take us outside the city, away from prying eyes...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Don't want to be seen murdering a girl in the streets of the Holy See, do they!? Even their staunchest supporters couldn't abide that!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Seems our new friend has already abandoned us. Naught for it, then. Back to Ishgard we go.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Come along, Rielle.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: You're not hurt, are you?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I trust you no longer dispute the true nature of the Temple Knights.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Murderers and thieves who drape themselves in the trappings of righteousness.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Do you not see, Forename!? We are all that stands between them and their prey!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: There is no justice for these monsters save that which we must deliver!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I will see them answer for their sins, I swear it! If I have to drown in the abyss to see it done, I will!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Forename, Sid, I...I wanted to thank you both for protecting me earlier! And...apologize for getting you two hurt...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Don't be foolish. You've naught to apologize for.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: In any case, at least we learned something of our enemies' motives.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Not that I have the faintest inkling of what the healer meant by “great spirit”...
